gov.anl.ipns.ViewTools.Panels.Transforms
Class CoordJPanel

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          javax.swing.JComponent
              javax.swing.JPanel
                  gov.anl.ipns.ViewTools.UI.ActiveJPanel
                      gov.anl.ipns.ViewTools.Panels.Transforms.CoordJPanel
All Implemented Interfaces:
IPreserveState, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible
Direct Known Subclasses:
ContourJPanel, GraphJPanel, ImageJPanel, ImageJPanel2, TranslationJPanel
public class CoordJPanel
extends ActiveJPanel
implements java.io.Serializable, IPreserveState

This class is a base class for panels that have a "world" coordinate system, cursors and zooming. These capabilities are implemented here for the ImageJPanel and GraphJPanel classes in particular. Both a full size crosshair cursor for pointing and a rubberband box for zooming are provided.

See Also:
Serialized Form

public static final java.lang.String ZOOM_IN
"Zoom In" - This constant String is a messaging string sent out by the CoordJPanel whenever the box cursor is used to zoom in on a region.

Constant Field Values

ZOOM_REGION

public static final java.lang.String ZOOM_REGION
"Zoom Region" - This constant String is a key for referencing the state information about the pixel bounds of the zoomed region. The value referenced by this key is of type Rectangle.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

HORIZONTAL_SCROLL

public static final java.lang.String HORIZONTAL_SCROLL
"Horizontal Scroll" - This constant String is a key for referencing the state information about the horizontal preferred size of the panel. If true, this will use automatic scroll bars if the horizontal dimension exceeds the window. Only set this true if the CoordJPanel is contained in a JScrollPane. The value referenced by this key is a primative boolean.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

VERTICAL_SCROLL

public static final java.lang.String VERTICAL_SCROLL
"Vertical Scroll" - This constant String is a key for referencing the state information about the vertical preferred size of the panel. If true, this will use automatic scroll bars if the vertical dimension exceeds the window. Only set this true if the CoordJPanel is contained in a JScrollPane. The value referenced by this key is a primative boolean.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

GLOBAL_BOUNDS

public static final java.lang.String GLOBAL_BOUNDS
"Global Bounds" - This constant String is a key for referencing the state information about the world and pixel coordinates for the initial panel. The value referenced by this key is of type CoordBounds.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

LOCAL_BOUNDS

public static final java.lang.String LOCAL_BOUNDS
"Local Bounds" - This constant String is a key for referencing the state information about the CoordTransform of the zoom region. The value referenced by this key is of type CoordBounds.

public static final java.lang.String CURRENT_POINT
"Current Point" - This constant String is a key for referencing the state information about the currently selected point. The value referenced by this key is of type Point.

Constant Field Values

EVENT_LISTENING

public static final java.lang.String EVENT_LISTENING
"Event Listening" - This constant String is a key for referencing the state information about whether this panel listens to mouse/key events. The value referenced by this key is a primative boolean and is true if listening.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

PREFERRED_SIZE

public static final java.lang.String PREFERRED_SIZE
"Preferred Size" - This constant String is a key for referencing the state information about the preferred size of this panel. Preferred size is set by my_setPreferredSize(). The value referenced by this key is of type Dimension.

getObjectState

public ObjectState getObjectState(boolean isDefault)
This method will get the current values of the state variables for this object. These variables will be wrapped in an ObjectState.

Specified by:
getObjectState in interface IPreserveState
Parameters:
isDefault - Should selective state be returned, that used to store user preferences common from project to project?
Returns:
if true, the default state containing user preferences, if false, the entire state, suitable for project specific saves.

Parameters:
dolisten - If true, process mouse events

setPreserveAspectRatio

public void setPreserveAspectRatio(boolean flag)
Set flag that controls whether the aspect ratio of the coordinate system should be preserved when the region is zoomed or resized.

Parameters:
flag - If true, the aspect ratio will be preserved.

setHorizontalScrolling

public void setHorizontalScrolling(boolean scroll)
Set flag that controls whether the preferred horizontal size will be set to the total number of pixels needed in the horizontal direction for the actual image or graph. If this is done and the panel is in JScrollPane with automatic scroll bars, setting this flag true will cause the scroll bars to be used if needed. This should ONLY be set true if the panel IS in a JScrollPane with an automatic horizontal scroll bar.

Parameters:
scroll - If true, the preferred size will be set, which will require scrolling if the image or graph has a large width.

setVerticalScrolling

public void setVerticalScrolling(boolean scroll)
Set flag that controls whether the preferred vertical size will be set to the total number of pixels needed in the vertical direction for the actual image or graph. If this is done and the panel is in JScrollPane with automatic scroll bars, setting this flag true will cause the scroll bars to be used if needed. This should ONLY be set true if the panel IS in a JScrollPane with an automatic vertical scroll bar.

Parameters:
scroll - If true, the preferred size will be set, which will require scrolling if the image or graph has a large height.

getZoom_region

public java.awt.Rectangle getZoom_region()
Get a rectangular subregion selected by user.

Returns:
a reference to the subregion (pixel Rectangle) of the panel that was selected by the rubber band box cursor.

public java.awt.Point getCurrent_pixel_point()
Get the point, in pixel coordinates that is pointed at by the user.

Returns:
a new point, with the coordinates of the pixel that is pointed at by the crosshair cursor or corner of the rubber band box.

getCurrent_WC_point

public floatPoint2D getCurrent_WC_point()
Get the point, in world coordinates that is pointed at by the user.

Returns:
a new point, with the world coordinates of the poing that is pointed at by the crosshair cursor or corner of the rubber band box.

getLocal_transform

public CoordTransform getLocal_transform()
Get a reference to the transformation between the current zoomed in region of the panel, and the pixel coordinates of the region.

Returns:
the local transform for the zoom region.

getGlobal_transform

public CoordTransform getGlobal_transform()
Get a reference to the transformation between the full coordinate system covering the full panel, and the pixel coordinates of the panel.

Returns:
the global transform for the panel.

initializeWorldCoords

public void initializeWorldCoords(CoordBounds b)
Set the world coordinate system for the panel to be the rectangle specified by the bounds parameter, b. Both the local and global transforms are map from the specified region.

Parameters:
b - The bounds that determine the world coordinate system for the panel.

setGlobalWorldCoords

public void setGlobalWorldCoords(CoordBounds b)
Set the world coordinate system for the global transform for the panel to be the rectangle specified by the bounds parameter, b.

Parameters:
b - The bounds that determine the world coordinate system for the panel.

getGlobalWorldCoords

public CoordBounds getGlobalWorldCoords()
Get the region that defines the world coordinate system for the full panel.

Returns:
A reference to the region in world coordinates that is mapped to the full panel by the global transform.

setLocalWorldCoords

public void setLocalWorldCoords(CoordBounds b)
Set the world coordinate system for the local transform for the panel to be the rectangle specified by the bounds parameter, b. The specified bounds are restricted to a subregion of the world coordinate region for the global transform.

Parameters:
b - The bounds that determine the world coordinate system for the zoomed subregion of the panel.

getLocalWorldCoords

public CoordBounds getLocalWorldCoords()
Get the region that defines the world coordinate system for the zoomed region of the panel.

Returns:
A reference to the region in world coordinates that is currently mapped to the full panel by the local transform.

showState

public void showState(java.lang.String str)
Print the current global and local coordinate bounds and the current point selected by the user.

set_crosshair_WC

public void set_crosshair_WC(floatPoint2D pt)
Draw the full size crosshair cursor at the specified world coordinate point and notify any action listeners that the CURSOR_MOVED.

Parameters:
pt - The point where the crosshair should be drawn

set_crosshair

public void set_crosshair(java.awt.Point current)
Draw the full size crosshair cursor at the specified pixel point point and notify any action listeners that the CURSOR_MOVED.

Parameters:
current - The point where the crosshair should be drawn

set_box_WC

public void set_box_WC(floatPoint2D pt)
Move the rubber band box cursor to the specified world coordinate point and notify any action listeners that the CURSOR_MOVED. If the rubber band box was not previously started, this will specifiy the initial point for the box. If the rubber band box was previously started, this will specify a new location for the other corner of the box.

Parameters:
pt - The point where the rubber band box should be drawn

set_box

public void set_box(java.awt.Point current)
Move the rubber band box cursor to the specified pixel point and notify any action listeners that the CURSOR_MOVED. If the rubber band box was not previously started, this will specifiy the initial point for the box. If the rubber band box was previously started, this will specify a new location for the other corner of the box.

Parameters:
current - The point where the rubber band box should be drawn

stop_crosshair_WC

public void stop_crosshair_WC(floatPoint2D pt)
Stop the crosshair cursor and set the current position to the specifed world coordinate point.

Parameters:
pt - The point to record as the current point, in world coordinates

stop_crosshair

public void stop_crosshair(java.awt.Point current)
Stop the crosshair cursor and set the current position to the specifed pixel coordinate point.

Parameters:
current - The point to record as the current point, in pixel coordinates

stop_box_WC

public void stop_box_WC(floatPoint2D pt,
                        boolean do_zoom)
Stop the rubber band box cursor and set the current position to the specifed world coordinate point. If do_zoom is true, change the transform to map the selected region to the full panel and notify listeners of the zoom-in request.

Parameters:
pt - the point to record as the current point, in world coordinates
do_zoom - flag specifying whether or not to zoom in on the selected region

stop_box

public void stop_box(java.awt.Point current,
                     boolean do_zoom)
Stop the rubber band box cursor and set the current position to the specifed pixel coordinate point. If do_zoom is true, change the transform to map the selected region to the full panel and notify listeners of the zoom-in request.

Parameters:
current - the point to record as the current point, in pixel coordinates
do_zoom - flag specifying whether or not to zoom in on the selected region

isDoingCrosshair

public boolean isDoingCrosshair()
Returns:
true if the crosshair cursor is currently active

isDoingBox

public boolean isDoingBox()
Returns:
true if the rubber band box cursor is currently active

SetTransformsToWindowSize

public void SetTransformsToWindowSize()

my_setPreferredSize

public void my_setPreferredSize(java.awt.Dimension preferredSize)
Set a size that this object will return in a call to getPreferredSize. However, we don't want to override the setPreferredSize method of this JPanel, since that has too many other uses. If derived classes such as ImageJPanel and GraphJPanel overided the getPreferredSize method, they should check if the preferred_size variable has been set. If so, they should return it, otherwise, they should calculate their own preferred size.

Parameters:
preferredSize - The size to return in calls to getPreferredSize. Pass in null to allow the derived class to calculate it's own preferred size.

main

public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
